line_1: At least while verse like mine endures:
line_2: Of verse like mine, of charms like yours.
The ling'ring, long, and heavy hours,

line_1: But the Sea-Dog uncommon Toil endures,
line_2: While She her Young from dreaded Harm secures.

line_1: For lost Psycarpax much my Soul endures,
line_2: 'Tis mine the private Grief, the publick, yours.

line_1: "The Cares and Troubles, which your Friend endures,
line_2: " Are all by Sympathy adopted yours. "

line_1: From all those evil moments guilt endures,
line_2: He talks of Conscience, which good men secures
And your fine sense, he said, and yours,

line_1: Fruitless her Aid, he still the wrack indures,
line_2: Beneath the Moon but one Elixer cures;

line_1: The Better; for, where Appetite endures,
line_2: Meats intermingle, and no Med'cine cures.

line_1: In this short absence if your love endures,
line_2: My heart and empire are for ever your's;

line_1: But those fell pangs which he endures,
line_2: Nor Time forgets, nor Kindness cures;
